summary: The Helping All Beneficiaries with Language Access Act of 2025 (HABLA Act) aims to improve language access for Limited English Proficient (LEP) individuals in federal programs and activities. It mandates federal agencies to create plans to ensure meaningful access for LEP individuals, consistent with the LEP Guidance. Agencies providing financial assistance must draft tailored guidance for their recipients regarding Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964. The bill requires consultations with stakeholders, including LEP persons, to develop practical and effective approaches. Definitions for 'LEP person' and 'eligible LEP person' are provided.
